title: TB COMPOSITION TEXT FLOW
content: when I compose an email and the sentence is long the last few characters are not visible. there is no way to create a right margin. how do I get the sentence to continue to the next line sooner so the characters are visible? J.E.
creator: j856979

title: How to open INBOX file
content:
Hi

I am having trouble finding emails with malicious attachments. I'm using one of ESET's security products which, after scans, find malicious content in the INBOX file, located locally on the device under the path %APPDATA%%RoamingThunderbirdProfiles(_Name_Of_the_profile)_Imapmail(_Name_of_mail)_INBOX(mail123). Unfortunately, the security product is unable to get rid of the dangerous file, but only gives information that something bad is in the email. When trying to find a specific email, I unfortunately run into a lot of problems. 1. the name of the email - in this case "mail123" does not exist in the thunderbird application itself. If I understand correctly, thunderbird itself chooses names for individual mails and then packs them in the INBOX file. 2. it is possible to correlate the email name from the INBOX file to the actual name(subject) of the email using other software such as MailStoreHome by importing the entire email profile (_Name_of_the_profile). 3. once the email is already correlated and found in MailStoreHome, I should be able to find the same email in Thunderbird (as I have imported the INBOX file, which is located locally, and which Thunderbird itself reads). Well, unfortunately no. Such an email in the Thunderbird mailbox (I already know the subject, content, date, etc.) does not exist.

And here comes my question. Is it possible to open the INBOX file itself and then find the unfortunate email and delete it?
creator: Zdenon

title: Immages not showing when opened
content: All of a sudden images are not shown when I open an e mail, doesn't matter what server it is coming from. I have tried all the suggestions listed I could find. The only new thing was Optus sent out a message to change from POP3 to IMAP if mail was being rejected by hotmail accounts.

creator: gattofelix49

title: ActivX/COM probleem
content:
Goedemorgen,

Af en toe gebruik ik CCleaner om het register van mijn computer te scannen op problemen. Meestal krijg ik dan de volgende waarschuwing te zien: ActiveX/COM-probleem InProcServer32\C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\notificationserver.dll

Nadat CCleaner het probleem heeft opgelost, verschijnt bij een volgende scan toch weer dezelfde waarschuwing.

CCleaner beschouwt ActivX/COM blijkbaar als een veiligheidsprobleem. Dus vraag ik mij af waarom ActivX/COM wordt gebruikt in Mozilla Thunderbird.

Ik ben benieuwd naar uw reactie.

Met vriendelijke groet,

Leo Steijn leo.steijn@ziggo.nl
creator: leo.steijn

title: Incoming emails
content:
My thunderbird has stopped receiving emails on my PC ( none sine 20 Jun 2024) I don't check the desktop PC every day as I normally use my phone for managing incoming and outgoing emails As a secondary use, I sometimes use my Laptop to Manage incoming and outgoing emails. Both the phone and the laptop are up to date with incoming emails. I can send an email to myself from the PC. Mozilla Thunderbird is up to date with auto update program.

Can someone please advise what steps I need to take to find out why this has just occurred. I am wondering if a recent auto update to Thunderbird has caused this issue . I am not ware if one can rollback to a previous Thunderbird revision to check if this is the cause? Any assistance will be greatly appreciated.

Thanks Greg
creator: gregblake
